Description: Name of the disease targeted by the vaccine
Type of pathogen targeted by the vaccine (e.g., bacteria, virus, parasite)
If known, the person or organization who developed the vaccine
If known, the particular strain or serotype targeted by the vaccine (e.g. MenACWY)
If known, the brandname of the vaccine
The type of vaccine (e.g. protein subunit, inactivated, live attenuated, etc.)
Only filled if not shown on the chart, with reason why (e.g., vaccine withdrawn - this is only noted if it was the first vaccine against a disease)
If the vaccine targets multiple pathogens (but not multiple strains or serotypes of the same pathogen)
